curated_text: Symbol: CVX. Year: 2025. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the U.S. Supreme Court, The U.S. Supreme Court, the Hawaii Supreme Court, Exxon Mobil Corp., D.P.R., Annapolis v. BP P.L.C., Plaintiff, City Council of Baltimore v. BP P.L.C., Bonta, Brabham Oil Co., S.C. Ct, Jennings v. BP America Inc., C.A. No, HUD, N.J. Super, Chevron Corp., Wash. Exchange Oil & Gas Corp., LLOG Exploration & Production Co., June Energy, Riverwood Production Company, Helis Oil & Gas Company, Northcoast Oil Company, Goodrich Petroleum Company, Devon Energy Production Company, Rozel Operating Co., Great Southern Oil & Gas Company, Inc., Hilcorp Energy Company, Apache Oil Corporation, Campbell Energy Corporation, Alpine Exploration Companies, Inc., Apache Corporation, Ballard Exploration Company, Inc., BP America Production Company, Brammer Engineering, Burlington Resources, Stutes v. Gulfport Energy Corporation, Vermilion Par, St. Bernard Parish, LLC, E.D. La., Gulf Coast. Context excerpt: competition statutes, violations of a federal antitrust statute, and violations of federal and state RICO statutes, based upon, among other things, the company’s production of oil and gas products and alleged misrepresentations or omissions relating to climate change risks associated with those products. Further such proceedings are likely to be brought by other parties. While defendants have sought to remove cases filed in state court to federal court, most of those cases have been remanded to state court and the U.S. Supreme Court has denied petitions for writ of certiorari on jurisdictional questions to date. The U.S. Supreme Court has also denied petitions for certiorari to review a decision from the Hawaii Supreme Court allowing claims brought by the City and County of Honolulu to proceed past the pleadings. The unprecedented legal theories set forth in these proceedings include claims for damages (both compensatory and punitive), injunctive and other forms of equitable relief, in
